title: Plantagenet relatives?
content:
I am looking for a font family with the same elegance, titling, etc. (and ornaments would be nice) as Plantagenet. Any suggestions?

 [‹ solotype font- signet](http://web.archive.org/web/20080609010916/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46177 "Go to previous forum topic") [Live Nation font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080609010916/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46134 "Go to next forum topic")
author: chadkdesign

comments.content:
I have a number of Plantagenet relatives. :) Starts back in the 1700s with Lady Anne Plantagenet, IIRC.

(Sorry, couldn’t resist.)

Regards,

T
What is it about Plantagenet that makes it so you won’t or can’t use it?

You could try selecting some of the Plantagenet characteristics you like and using the [Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20080609010916/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsearch.php) to get suggestions of fonts with those features. I tried it and one idea was Clifford, so I agree with Stephen’s suggestion.

- Mike Yanega
